* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* normally appears in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                         |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | [EvilHack - monst.c, line 2681](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/master/src/monst.c#L2681)                                                                       |

A **hobbit zombie**, Z, is a type of monster that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [zombified](/wiki/Zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Zombie (EvilHack)") form of [hobbit](/index.php?title=Hobbit_\(monster_attribute\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Hobbit (monster attribute) (page does not exist)") that behaves the same as zombies of other species.

A hobbit zombie has a [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") claw attack that drains [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution") and a brain-eating bite attack that can cause a zombifying [illness](/wiki/Illness "Illness"). Drow zombies possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), and a [vulnerability](/wiki/Vulnerability "Vulnerability") to [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire").

## Generation

Randomly generated hobbit zombies are always created hostile, and may appear in small [groups](/wiki/Group "Group").

A hobbit zombie may [revive](/wiki/Revive "Revive") after being destroyed if it leaves a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse").

[Hobbit](/wiki/Hobbit_\(starting_race\) "Hobbit (starting race)") characters and monsters killed by zombies or their infection will arise as a hobbit zombie.

## Encyclopedia entry

The zombi... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but  
taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a  
mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is  
made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.  
\[ W. B. Seabrook ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Hobbit_zombie\&action=edit)*

html:
Hobbit zombie

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Z hobbit zombie (No tile)
Difficulty 3
Attacks Claw 1d6 poisonous (constitution), Bite 1d2 intelligence drain
Z hobbit zombie (No tile)
Difficulty 3
Attacks

Claw 1d6 poisonous (constitution), Bite 1d2 intelligence drain

Base level 2
Base experience 9
Speed 3
Base AC 9
Base MR 0
Alignment -3 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 850
Nutritional value 75
Size Medium
Resistances cold,sleep,poison,level drain
Resistances conveyed None

A hobbit zombie:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • has infravision.
  • normally appears in small groups.
  • never leaves a corpse.
Reference EvilHack - monst.c, line 2681

A hobbit zombie, Z, is a type of monster that appears in EvilHack and Hack'EM. It is a zombified form of hobbit that behaves the same as zombies of other species.

A hobbit zombie has a poisonous claw attack that drains constitution and a brain-eating bite attack that can cause a zombifying illness. Drow zombies possess cold resistance, sleep resistance, poison resistance, drain resistance, and a vulnerability to fire.

Generation

Randomly generated hobbit zombies are always created hostile, and may appear in small groups.

A hobbit zombie may revive after being destroyed if it leaves a corpse.

Hobbit characters and monsters killed by zombies or their infection will arise as a hobbit zombie.

Encyclopedia entry

The zombi... is a soulless human corpse, still dead, but
taken from the grave and endowed by sorcery with a
mechanical semblance of life, -- it is a dead body which is
made to walk and act and move as if it were alive.
[ W. B. Seabrook ]

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''hobbit zombie''', {{green|Z}}, is a type of monster that appears in [[EvilHack]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[Zombie (EvilHack)|zombified]] form of [[Hobbit (monster attribute)|hobbit]] that behaves the same as zombies of other species.

A hobbit zombie has a [[poisonous]] claw attack that drains [[constitution]] and a brain-eating bite attack that can cause a zombifying [[illness]]. Drow zombies possess [[cold resistance]], [[sleep resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[drain resistance]], and a [[vulnerability]] to [[fire]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated hobbit zombies are always created hostile, and may appear in small [[group]]s.

A hobbit zombie may [[revive]] after being destroyed if it leaves a [[corpse]].

[[Hobbit (starting race)|Hobbit]] characters and monsters killed by zombies or their infection will arise as a hobbit zombie.
